en_question:
A company produces product A and product B. Each unit of product A sold generates a profit of £30, while each unit of product B sold generates a profit of £10. The company can allocate a maximum of 40 hours per week for production. Producing one unit of product A requires 6 hours, while producing one unit of product B requires 3 hours. Market demand requires that the quantity of product B produced must be at least three times the quantity of product A. The storage space occupied by product A is four times that of product B, and a maximum of four units of product A can be stored per week.

Formulate a model for this problem.
